description.raw:
I found a minor problem related with man pages. If I'm not wrong, our cmake does not trigger the generation of `gz.1.gz` containing the updated version of the man page when we modify `gz.1.roff`.

How to reproduce the problem?

* Use a different branch, and make some change in `tools/gz.1.roff`. Run `make install` and then type `man gz`. The man page won't reflect your change unless you remove your `gz.1.gz` from your `build` directory.

This pull request should fix the problem and trigger the generation of `tools/gz.1.gz` if we modify `tools/gz.1roff`.

[trusty no gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/989/) is happy.

How to reproduce the problem?

This pull request should fix the problem and trigger the generation of tools/gz.1.gz if we modify tools/gz.1roff.

trusty no gpu is happy.

title: Fix man page generation dependecies
